ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] When to try something else?
ygData.msgSnippet: High Int and Cha are indeed good for the purposes with which you associated them, but the only factor that determines your sucess rate is your skill level. ...
ygData.messageBody:
High Int and Cha are indeed good for the purposes with which you associated
them, but the only factor that determines your sucess rate is your skill
level.

----- Original Message -----
From: Brian Finley <brian@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 09, 2001 5:54 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] When to try something else?


> What's everyone's typical stats when you're doing the tinkering?
>
> I'm trying to figure if like high dexterity or high wisdom plays a big
part in
> success (I know high Int is supposed to help increase skill faster, and
CHA
> let's you buy and sell for less/more). My wisdom is ok, but not great. I
> think I read that wisdom plays a big part on success.
>
> I imagine most swap on some CHA gear, and do their buying and selling...
but
> when you're tinkering, what items are you primarily wearing that give you
the
> high stats needed for success?
>
> - Tynkur of Lanys T'Vyl
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Tom Magrino" <lord_wire@...>
> To: <EQ_Tinkering@egroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, January 09, 2001 2:44 PM
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] When to try something else?
>
>
> > My skill is 125 or so and I make aqualungs fairly
> > easily. You might as well make these to make some
> > money instead of doing catapults.
> > --- Joe D <joed@...> wrote:
> > > On Mon, Jan 08, 2001 at 11:41:07PM -0800, Brian
> > > Finley wrote:
> > > > At what skill level will I have like a 25% chance
> > > of even accomplishing this
> > > > item? Obviously I'll continue making Powered
> > > Gloves until the trivial mark
> > > > at 122, and then trying aqualungs.
> > >
> > > I'd recommend doing catapults before aqualungs.
> > >
> > > Pasketti of Povar
> > >
> >
> >
> > __________________________________________________

> >
